2: Place the game board in the center of the table.
3: Shuffle the master room tiles. Draw 3 plus the number of players and place them face up next to the board. Return the rest to the game box. Place the King's Statue near the board.
4: According to the number of players, stack Warehouses, Gem Workshops, Magic Arcaenums, and Libraries in their marked areas on the board. Return any remaining rooms of these types to the game box.
6: Individually shuffle the three sets of specialist cards (A, B, & C). Then draw cards facedown from each set according to the number of players. Return the remaining specialist cards to the box.
8: Stack the specialists A on top of B on top of C, then place the combined deck on the board. Draw the first 5 specialist cards and place them face up in a row.
9: Place all the coins in the center of the board.
10: According to the number of players place resources in their marked areas on the board. Return any unused resources to the game box.
12: Stack one Bedchamber | Kitchen per player and one Great Hall | Barracks per player on their marked spots on the board. Return any remaining chambers to the box.
13: Individually shuffle the three types of quest cards (Age I [Gems and Magic], Age I [Cloth, Leather, Metal, Wood], Age II). According to the number of players, draw cards facedown from each of the three shuffled sets of quest cards. Return the remaining quest cards to the game box.
15: Shuffle the two sets of Age I quest cards together, then create the quest deck by placing top to bottom: Age I quest cards, King's Funeral card, Age II quest cards, Offering to the Council card.
16: Draw and place 5 quest cards face-up in the empty slots. For a 5-6 player game, remove the quest deck from the board and place a 6th quest card in its place.
17: Individually shuffle the blue, red, and yellow treasure cards. Place each deck on its marked area on the board.
18: Shuffle the player boards and deal one to each player. Return any remaining player boards to the game box.
19: The player who most recently had an adventure is the starting player. Going clockwise take coins as follows:
21: Shuffle the guild tiles and deal one to each player (you can use this application for this step). Players take their guild sigil minis and place their guild tiles on their player boards. Return unused guilds and sigils to the box. Going clockwise from the starting player, each player takes the starting bonus printed on their guild tile. Then the starting player takes the first turn and play proceeds clockwise.
